results.title: Report from the Aleutians
results.creator_credit: John Huston and United States. Army. Signal Corps
results.brief_description: A documentary of life on a lonely airbase on Adak Island in the Aleutians during World War II. For the men of the base, the enemy was the snow, mud, grey skies and boredom punctuated by an occasional bombing raid. John Huston spent six months on the Island and was nearly killed while filming the climactic raid.

results.title: Pearl Harbour December 7th
results.brief_description: A few cameras were on hand to record the Japanese attack on Pearl Harbour on December 7th 1941, film director John Ford’s unit was given the task of recreating many of the major scenes on Hollywood sound stages. Generations of Americans have witnessed the scenes, not realising the attack is actually Ford’s skilful illusion. Historically, the film is accurate in every detail. Winner of the Academy Award for Documentary Production in 1943.

results.title: Take heart
results.creator_credit: Penny Cordell, Film and Television Institute (W.A.) and Women's Film Fund AFC
results.brief_description: Western Australia nuclar disarmament protesters tell how they became active protesters against the United States nuclear ships using Coburn Sound. With the help of Dr Helen Caldicott the Nuclear Disarmement Party was formed in 1948 and they campaigned to have Senator Jo Valentine elected to the Australian Parliament. Shows how a small grassroots level group can succed in political ctivity.

results.title: Family of chimps
results.brief_description: A documentary recording the day-to-day activities of a chimpanzee family living in an open enclosure surrounded by a moat at Burgers Zoo in Arnheim. Scientists and the public observe their behaviour unobtrusively from a distance.

results.title: VFL: skills
results.brief_description: Step-by-step Australian Rules instructions, skills and techniques demonstrated by senior VFL players. A vital tool in mastering all aspects of this modern, national game for all kids. Includes interviews with Dennis Carroll, Tim Watson and Todd Viney. No other credits available.

results.title: The Guide to 35mm photography
results.brief_description: Brian Ratty introduces this instructional video on how to use a 35mm camera. The program is divided into three half-hour chapters. Part one covers: How the SLR works, “f” stops and shutter speeds, exposure, depth of field and film. Part two covers: Lenses, available light, flash, filters and steady shooting. Part three covers: seeing with the camera, candids, portraits, the environmental portrait and sports and action.

results.title: Dumbo. Father Noah's ark. The Practical pig. Three orphan pigs.
results.brief_description: One of Disney’s most endearing animated films. Dumbo is the story of a baby circus animal born with oversized ears. Snubbed and ridiculed by all the other circus animals, he is befriended by Timothy, a small but spirited mouse. After Dumbo is involved in several disastrous performances under the big top, Timothy decides to launch Dumbo as a new star - the world’s only flying elephant. Also included in this program are three Disney cartoons: “Father Noah’s ark”, “The Practical pig”, and “Three orphan kittens”.
results.title_for_label: Dumbo. Father Noah’s ark. The Practical pig. Three orphan pigs.

results.title: Making of a legend: Gone with the wind
results.creator_credit: David Hinton, L. Jeffrey Selznick, Selznick Properties and Turner Entertainment
results.brief_description: A feature length documentary which takes a behind-the-scenes look at the making of the 1939 feature film “Gone With the Wind”. Utilises some rare film footage including several screen tests for the part of Scarlett O’Hara, and home movies featuring Vivien Leigh. A fascinating inside view of one of the great accomplishments in motion picture history. Narrated by Christopher Plummer.

results.title: Keeping warm
results.brief_description: Examines the problems involved in keeping people warm. Humans generate their own body heat and try to keep warm by trapping heat next to the body with layers of clothing. Houses too need proper insulation if they are to retain the warmth from heating sources. This program looks at a computer- controlled house where getting up, having a bath and watching television happen to order; saving energy and money.
